abstract: Pope Francis's elevation of Father Serra, Spanish missionary who helped colonize California, to sainthood has revived battle between Catholics who support move and Native Americans who say Serra was agent of oppression and genocide; vandalizing of Serra statue at Carmel Mission illustrates conflict, though tribal leaders say they had nothing to do with the damage.
lead_paragraph: The legacy of Father Serra, who was canonized last week, has been disputed by Native Americans who say he oppressed their forebears as he worked to convert them to Catholicism.

headline.main: Sainthood of Junípero Serra Reopens Wounds of Colonialism in California
headline.print_headline: Sainthood of Serra Reopens Wounds of Colonialism in California
